website_summaries.verdict: A professional-level teleprompter by a popular brand for this type of equipment that's also reasonably priced.
pros: Attractive features that include a rugged build, beam split glass, and a mid-range price
Compatible with most cameras that fit the tripod
cons: Won't work with tablets larger than 10.5 inches
Angle can be challenging to adjust

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a Canon C100/200 and the camera mount was so cheap and wasn't actually level once the camera was installed. The camera angled up and was actually looking at the top of the mirror, completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: McCay

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with my DSLR and Ipad + Ipad mini
customer_reviews.text: Setup was straightforward, documentation is just a single page but honestly it's self explanatory. Build is solid, but the metal does have sharp edges so be careful. For over $200 they could have rounded off those edges a bit... Otherwise it would be a perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: dave m

customer_reviews.title: it is great although somehow pricey for that gadget
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars except for the camera tent and the relationship of the sliders, teleprompter and the camera. but with a tablet and a camera, light, microphone you get a great studio.
customer_reviews.author: MasterStylist

customer_reviews.title: Angle cannot be adjusted :(
customer_reviews.text: Not a terrible product, but a glaring shortcoming... The default 45 degree angle is incorrect for just about any tablet we tried using. The top half of the tablet gets cut off when the camera is aimed correctly at the subject. This would have been an incredibly easy feature to add by drilling a few more holes in the frame at the side, so that the user could choose the appropriate angle for their view of the tablet, but sadly this was overlooked.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nodwell

customer_reviews.title: Great teleprompter
customer_reviews.text: What can I said we love this teleprompter makes our recording so much easier I just wish there were extension tubes
customer_reviews.author: Josue

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have an easily adjustable angle
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have an easily adjustable angle. So if the talent is too tall, too short, too far, too close - they can't read the prompter. This is fixable with tape... but then again, most things are.
customer_reviews.author: Jayoe Heater

customer_reviews.title: Incredible device
customer_reviews.text: Video shoots have never been the same! This device works incredible and it's really portable!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Florencia

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap. Take that for what's it's worth.
customer_reviews.text: I would argue that anyone on here describing this as a "professional" piece of gear is probably not a professional. The glass is of decent quality, and that is it. The rest is made of cheap metal and not very durable. Also, all the metal parts were covered in some kind of oil coating that was pretty nasty. Easy enough to wipe off, but still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but is very flimsy and I don't quite feel ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but is very flimsy and I don't quite feel confident that it's gonna hold if I over-tighten the screws.
customer_reviews.author: holyMOLy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. It was easy to set up and works exactly as expected. I have used it myself and with a 10-year-old grandson. I think it is a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Naramor

customer_reviews.title: Studio MUST!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing... screen is easily readable when using a tablet with it (not included) Use parrot teleprompter app for free and your good to go... never forget your lines again.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Masterman

customer_reviews.title: Able to move the camera up and down
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few cheap teleprompters that you can move the camera up and down to optimize the position of the camera to where the subject is reading.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Melton

customer_reviews.title: good gear
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it should. I found the carrying case it comes in to be useless, so I keep it in a separate box without folding it for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Foss

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR SIMPLE TELEPROMPTER NEEDS
customer_reviews.text: VERY QUICK TO ASSEMBLE AND USE. WORTH THE FEW HUNDRED DOLLARS TO GET A TELEPROMPTER FOR MY DLSR SETUP!
customer_reviews.author: david.grainger

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product really exceeded my expectations considering the price. Very satisfied!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Tobler

customer_reviews.title: Limited screen visibility
customer_reviews.text: The angle of prompter causes some of the screen to be cut off so you’re basically left with two lines visible to read from - not ideal. But as the saying goes, you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Joseph Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent on camera prompter
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed and set up was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Eweiss

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Just what I need for the short ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Just what I need for the short videos I have to do.
customer_reviews.author: GeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived today online and looks great! Just spent some time trying it out and I'm thrilled with the product. Because it was less expensive than many other models I was concerned about the quality, but I didn't need to be. It's sturdy and seems to be built of great materials. #HappyCustomer.
customer_reviews.author: Rathbun Family

customer_reviews.title: No no nooooooooo!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Waste of money and you will regret buying this. I spent hours trying to rig this thing to work with my cameras and then I had to get a different Teleprompter software to work with it that doesn’t show my text the way I spaced it total nightmare as I was getting ready for a shoot and had spent days writing scripts.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy K.

customer_reviews.title: It works ok but mirror has ghosting of text
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if every teleprompter glass has ghosting but this one definitely does. Also has that a rainbow effect (think oil puddle). Annoying but still useable. Expected more for the price. Build quality is a bit cheap, screws are fiddly and the case also sucks. The padding is just cheap foam (the kind used to protect tvs/electronics when shipping) that doesn't stay in place and is cut a bit too tight. I guess when there's nothing else in the price range you have no choice...
customer_reviews.author: dannoTop Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: Glide Gear TMP 500 Universal Video Camera Tripod Teleprompter 15mm Rails w/ Carry Case
feature_bullets: NEW FEATURES 7-25-20 adjustable glass position fitted camera sock accessory mounting options -- 70/30 Beam Splitting Glass/ Reflective Screen size 10.5 x 8.5 Inches
Collapsible with carry bag/ Canvas Camera Sock to prevent glare
Designed to shoot with DSLR/ Mirrorless Cameras. Prompting use with Android and IOS Teleprompter apps / Accommodates any smartphone or tablet up to 10.5 x 9.5 Inches
Comes with optional camera riser and 15mm rail extensions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars48 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
